name: Genetic Algorithm
description: Population-based metaheuristic that evolves solutions through selection, crossover, and mutation inspired by natural evolution
when_to_use: When the search space is large and unstructured
Multi-objective optimization where Pareto frontiers are sought
when_not_to_use: Small continuous problems where gradient descent is faster
When function evaluations are very expensive (many generations needed)
When analytical solutions exist or problem is convex
embedding_text: Genetic algorithms mimic natural evolution to solve optimization problems. Maintains population of candidate solutions, applies selection pressure on fitness, performs crossover to combine solutions, and mutation for exploration. No gradients needed. Works well on discrete, combinatorial, and multimodal problems. Requires many fitness evaluations.
